results.title: A Holiday in South India
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, Documentary Films of India and Jagat Murari
results.brief_description: A family is seen holidaying in South India. Shows the hotels, street scenes, shopping facilities, handwoven fabrics and souvenirs obtainable; trips to places of interest.

results.title: A Hole in the ground
results.brief_description: A pictorial and sound experiment in which there is virtually no subject movement. All movement is relayed by way of camera and sound track. On a ghost train a ghost of a man comes to town. He makes his way to the hub of that town, the gold mine. Working there, he is killed in a cave-in and remains as one of the town’s permanent residents in the cemetery.

results.title: A History of the game
results.creator_credit: Ray Marshall, Terry Ryan and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
The first of a seven part series on soccer skills. Traces the history of soccer in England, and in the second half of the film Manchester City’s Mick Channon looks at the basic skills which every soccer player needs. Provides clear explan ations of training drills and relates these to actual match situations. Narrated by Hugh Jones.

results.title: A History of Australian art. Part 3 (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian art”.
This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1970-1991. It investigates experimental art - Performance and Happenings, the influence of Feminism and the international and commercial success of Aboriginal art. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA. IBM PC and Compatible; Windows 3.1 or higher, 4MB RAM, 4MB free disk space, VGA display, MPC Compatible CD ROM XA.

results.title: A History of Australian art. Part 2 (MAC & PC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Australian art”.
This is a definitive collection of important Australian artists from the period 1920-1970. From Margaraet Preston to Brett Whitely, controversial modernist art, and the influence of American styles such as Abstract Expressionism. Key works from galleries across Australia and a lively commentary provide an informed history emphasising critical developments in Australian art. Includes high-resolution images, multi-level presentations and commentary, full lists of artists with additional information, close-up views of any part of each image and a detailed study guide with key to the works. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Macintosh LC, 2MB RAM, 1MB free disc space, 8 bit colour card, system 6.0.5 or higher, CD ROM XA. IBM PC and Compatible; Windows 3.1 or higher, 4MB RAM, 4MB free disk space, VGA display, MPC Compatible CD ROM XA.

results.title: A History for the future: Australian women in science and technology
results.brief_description: This video brings out of the shadows some Australian women whose achievements in science and technology have been largely unacknowledged. It attempts to redress the situation by bringing into focus some examples of their successes. It also makes the point that through the determination and dedication of women in the past, women today have inherited the right to forge a career for themselves in any field they choose. Evocative vignettes from the past together with pictures and interviews featuring modern women form an excellent vehicle for further discussion. Suitable for years 7 - 12.

results.title: A Hard course
results.creator_credit: Stanley Williamson, BBC-TV and Arthur Smith
results.brief_description: The arguments for and against the system of intensive training for boys and girls at the Outward Bound Mountain School in Cumberland. The school aims at “character training through adventure and testing experience”.

results.title: A Happy childhood
results.brief_description: An English language version of a Russian propaganda film promoting the virtues of Stalinist policies for the protection of children’s welfare. If much of this socialist child-rearing looks severe and Spartan, the film is punctuated throughout by genuine moments of charm and whimsy. In many respects this is an enchanting film; accordingly, the film is a fascinating study in propaganda cinema.

results.title: A Great ship
results.creator_credit: Anthony Gilkison, Rayant Pictures, British Information Services and John Reeve
results.brief_description: P&O decided in 1955 to build the largest passenger liner since World War II, the Canberra. This documentary focuses on the construction of the vessel, followed by her maiden voyage.
